results.title: Touch the Sun : Princess Kate (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: George Ogilvie and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Thirteen year old Kate’s world is turned topsy turvy when she learns she is adopted. Unaware of the pain she is causing her adoptive family, Kate searches for her “real” parents. Her unexpected arrival on the doorstep of her natural mother stirs up mixed emotions. Kate succeeds in befriending her half-sister May before returning home to her adoptive parents with a new understanding of herself and her relationships. Rated: G.

results.title: Touch the Sun : Peter and Pompey (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Michael Carson, Margot McDonald and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
When three children from a small coastal town find Latin inscriptions on the walls of a local cave it leads to the discovery of an authentic Roman boat. News of the find throws the town into turmoil. The town’s people rush to implement crass commercial schemes to exploit the Roman boat’s tourist potential. Angered by the way the boat’s discovery has disrupted their lives the children devise a way to restore the town to normal.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Carson, Margot McDonald and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Touch the Sun : Devil's Hill (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jill Robb, Esben Storm and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Badge, a young boy, lives with his parents on a struggling farm in the Tasmanian bush. When Badge’s city cousins come to stay he finds their brash opinions unsettling. Following a violent storm the farm’s viability is threatened by the death of one cow and the escape of another. The children’s quest to recapture the cow leads them to the mysterious crag, Devil’s Hill. In conquering the perils of the mountain the children set aside their bickering and discover the value of co-operation. Rated: G
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jill Robb, Esben Storm and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Touch the Sun : Captain Johnno (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Mario Andreacchio, Jane Ballantyne and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Touch the Sun Series”.
Johnno, an energetic and sensitive 10 year old, resides in a small coastal fishing town. His father’s inability to come to terms with Johnno’s deafness exacerbates their already troubled relationship. To curb Johnno’s rebelliousness his father proposes to send him to a “special school”. On learning of this plan Johnno flees to a nearby island to live like Robinson Crusoe. An Italian fisherman, who has earlier befriended Johnno, finds him on the island and endeavours to persuade him to return and face his problems. Rated: G
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mario Andreacchio, Jane Ballantyne and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Touch the Sun : Captain Johnno
results.creator_credit: Mario Andreacchio, Jane Ballantyne and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Johnno, an energetic and sensitive 10 year old, resides in a small coastal fishing town. His father’s inability to come to terms with Johnno’s deafness exacerbates their already troubled relationship. To curb Johnno’s rebelliousness, his father proposes to send him to a “special school”. On learning of this plan Johnno flees to a nearby island to live like Robinson Crusoe. An Italian fisherman, who has earlier befriended Johnno, finds him on the island and endeavours to persuade him to return and face his problems. Cast includes: Damien Walters - Captain Johnno Rebecca Sykes - Julie Michelle Fawdon - Kathleen Joe Petruzzi - Tony Written by Rob George, music by Stephen Matters. Rated G.

results.title: Touch and go
results.brief_description: The modern methods of teaching used in Malaya’s schools for the blind are doing much to lessen the handicaps of blindness. Young children grow in confidence as they learn new skills such as basket making and reading braille. Older students are seen using braille typewriters and operating the special telephone switchboard made by the Malayan Telecommunications Department.
results.description: The modern methods of teaching used in Malaya’s schools for the blind are doing much to lessen the handicaps of blindness. Young children grow in confidence as they learn new skills such as basket making and reading braille. Older students are seen using braille typewriters and operating the special telephone switchboard made by the Malayan Telecommunications Department.

results.title: Total war: 1941-1945
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Hitler’s Germany”.
The most urgent problems facing Germany in the 1920’s and early 30’s were inflation, massive unemployment and political violence. This series examines Hitler’s solution to these problems and the rise and fall of the Third Reich as told by people who were there. Part 3 is set against the growing nightmare of mass bombing, invasion and finally defeat by the allied forces. The war against Russia brought no triumphs and in 1942 the war came to Germany with constant bombing raids ruining factories and placing heavy demands on medical and food services. We see the 1943 bombing of Hamburg, the retreat and submission of the German army and the final demands of Hitler, leading to 250,000 deaths in an attempt to defend Berlin.

results.title: Total fitness in 30 minutes a week
results.brief_description: A simple, thirty-minute-a week program for achieving physical fitness is outlined and demonstrated by Dr Laurence Morehouse and journalist Leonard Gross. The film is very specific in its training techniques for achieving total fitness. The teaching methods are direct and easy to follow
